newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai stocks up in sluggish trade by lunch.
newsitem.headline: Thai stocks up in sluggish trade by lunch.

text.p: Thai stocks gained marginally in lacklustre trade by the lunch break on Friday in line with advances of most regional markets, brokers said.
"Gains at several regional markets help boost sentiment this morning. But turnover was thin as investors turned cautious ahead of the long weekend," said a broker at Securities One.
The market will be closed on Monday on the Coronation Day holiday.
The composite SET index rose 0.99 point to 662.28 on thin 906 million baht half-day turnover.
Brokers said the bearish outlook may have sidelined investors.
The banking sector topped the active list rising 0.33 percent.
Large capitalised TelecomAsia gained 0.75 baht to 40.25, Bangkok Bank slipped one to 171, and theme park operator Safari World advanced 11 to 157.
